## Description {#details}

Tracks responsibility for materialization, and mediates interactions between MaterializationUnits and JDs.

An instance of this class is passed to MaterializationUnits when their materialize method is called. It allows MaterializationUnits to resolve and emit symbols, or abandon materialization by notifying any unmaterialized symbols of an error.

Definition at line 571 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/executionengine/include/llvm/executionengine/orc/core-h">Core.h</a>.

## Public Member Functions

### defineMaterializing() {#a62fb82b43ab2e73f76ba2b0bf26ad769}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>Error llvm::orc::MaterializationResponsibility::defineMaterializing (<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/orc/#afd6431981e7fdfd4b5d2794f04d7d913">SymbolFlagsMap</a> SymbolFlags)</>}
  labels = {["inline"]}>
Attempt to claim responsibility for new definitions.

This method can be used to claim responsibility for symbols that are added to a materialization unit during the compilation process (e.g. literal pool symbols). Symbol linkage rules are the same as for symbols that are defined up front: duplicate strong definitions will result in errors. Duplicate weak definitions will be discarded (in which case they will not be added to this responsibility instance).

This method can be used by materialization units that want to add additional symbols at materialization time (e.g. stubs, compile callbacks, metadata).

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/executionengine/include/llvm/executionengine/orc/core-h/#l00665">665</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/executionengine/include/llvm/executionengine/orc/core-h">Core.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### delegate() {#ab3707131b6242e99a95a8d44a8f28148}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>Expected&lt; std::unique&#95;ptr&lt; MaterializationResponsibility &gt; &gt; llvm::orc::MaterializationResponsibility::delegate (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/orc/#ada98b2ca88b7bc4b65b62e3269fdade7">SymbolNameSet</a> &amp; Symbols)</>}
  labels = {["inline"]}>
Delegates responsibility for the given symbols to the returned materialization responsibility.

Useful for breaking up work between threads, or different kinds of materialization processes.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/executionengine/include/llvm/executionengine/orc/core-h/#l00685">685</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/executionengine/include/llvm/executionengine/orc/core-h">Core.h</a>.

### failMaterialization() {#af1822b8a750eaaa5a35976e7b90b8c34}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="void llvm::orc::MaterializationResponsibility::failMaterialization ()"
  labels = {["inline"]}>
Notify all not-yet-emitted covered by this <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/orc/materializationresponsibility">MaterializationResponsibility</a> instance that an error has occurred.

This will remove all symbols covered by this <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/orc/materializationresponsibility">MaterializationResponsibility</a> from the target <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/orc/jitdylib">JITDylib</a>, and send an error to any queries waiting on these symbols.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/executionengine/include/llvm/executionengine/orc/core-h/#l00672">672</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/executionengine/include/llvm/executionengine/orc/core-h">Core.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### getRequestedSymbols() {#aa122cad77bee05d26881ed2881b18141}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="SymbolNameSet llvm::orc::MaterializationResponsibility::getRequestedSymbols () const"
  labels = {["inline"]}>
Returns the names of any symbols covered by this <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/orc/materializationresponsibility">MaterializationResponsibility</a> object that have queries pending.

This information can be used to return responsibility for unrequested symbols back to the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/orc/jitdylib">JITDylib</a> via the delegate method.

### notifyEmitted() {#ae3a8d9b6fd3d07c66e5992645636cc9b}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>Error llvm::orc::MaterializationResponsibility::notifyEmitted (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/arrayref">ArrayRef</a>&lt; <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/orc/symboldependencegroup">SymbolDependenceGroup</a> &gt; DepGroups)</>}
  labels = {["inline"]}>
Notifies the target <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/orc/jitdylib">JITDylib</a> (and any pending queries on that <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/orc/jitdylib">JITDylib</a>) that all symbols covered by this <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/orc/materializationresponsibility">MaterializationResponsibility</a> instance have been emitted.

The DepGroups array describes the dependencies of symbols being emitted on symbols that are outside this <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/orc/materializationresponsibility">MaterializationResponsibility</a> object. Each group consists of a pair of a set of symbols and a <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/orc/#ad4c600dd1184757dace1280e114f5b15">SymbolDependenceMap</a> that describes the dependencies for the symbols in the first set. The elements of DepGroups must be non-overlapping (no symbol should appear in more than one of hte symbol sets), but do not have to be exhaustive. <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/any">Any</a> symbol in this <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/orc/materializationresponsibility">MaterializationResponsibility</a> object that is not covered by an entry will be treated as having no dependencies.

This method will return an error if any symbols being resolved have been moved to the error state due to the failure of a dependency. If this method returns an error then clients should log it and call failMaterialize. If no dependencies have been registered for the symbols covered by this <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/orc/materializationresponsibility">MaterializationResponsibility</a> then this method is guaranteed to return <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/error/#a4dfd0813c3d0e0a30439b5a3e9196b59">Error::success()</a> and can be wrapped with cantFail.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/executionengine/include/llvm/executionengine/orc/core-h/#l00652">652</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/executionengine/include/llvm/executionengine/orc/core-h">Core.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### notifyResolved() {#a09bd8178b347a0bd65353b5df15a38b8}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>Error llvm::orc::MaterializationResponsibility::notifyResolved (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/orc/#a8ab9a099de556e888c5f92a4fe49d2fa">SymbolMap</a> &amp; Symbols)</>}
  labels = {["inline"]}>
Notifies the target <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/orc/jitdylib">JITDylib</a> that the given symbols have been resolved.

This will update the given symbols&#39; addresses in the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/orc/jitdylib">JITDylib</a>, and notify any pending queries on the given symbols of their resolution. The given symbols must be ones covered by this <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/orc/materializationresponsibility">MaterializationResponsibility</a> instance. Individual calls to this method may resolve a subset of the symbols, but all symbols must have been resolved prior to calling emit.

This method will return an error if any symbols being resolved have been moved to the error state due to the failure of a dependency. If this method returns an error then clients should log it and call failMaterialize. If no dependencies have been registered for the symbols covered by this <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/orc/materializationresponsibility">MaterializationResponsibility</a> then this method is guaranteed to return <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/error/#a4dfd0813c3d0e0a30439b5a3e9196b59">Error::success()</a> and can be wrapped with cantFail.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/executionengine/include/llvm/executionengine/orc/core-h/#l00631">631</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/executionengine/include/llvm/executionengine/orc/core-h">Core.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### replace() {#a478a47066e15af63dfaff33f899f9ff0}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>Error llvm::orc::MaterializationResponsibility::replace (std::unique&#95;ptr&lt; <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/orc/materializationunit">MaterializationUnit</a> &gt; MU)</>}
  labels = {["inline"]}>
Transfers responsibility to the given <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/orc/materializationunit">MaterializationUnit</a> for all symbols defined by that <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/orc/materializationunit">MaterializationUnit</a>.

This allows materializers to break up work based on run-time information (e.g. by introspecting which symbols have actually been looked up and materializing only those).

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/executionengine/include/llvm/executionengine/orc/core-h/#l00679">679</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/executionengine/include/llvm/executionengine/orc/core-h">Core.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### withResourceKeyDo() {#a5212856dfb6ccde003f082318cfb4e65}

<MemberDefinition
  template={<>template &lt;typename Func&gt;</>}
  prototype={<>Error llvm::orc::MaterializationResponsibility::withResourceKeyDo (Func &amp;&amp; F) const</>}
  labels = {["inline"]}>
Runs the given callback under the session lock, passing in the associated <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/orc/#a48eb648e96394270c69273c29bfad24e">ResourceKey</a>.

This is the safe way to associate resources with trackers.

</MemberDefinition>
